did.abstract: Collection contains Cocke's letters concerning the purchase of land in Perry Co., Ala., the weather, crop conditions, prices, and the health of slaves. Other items include letters to Dr. Cary Charles Cocke, son of J.H. Cocke; a report on the progress of a younger John Hartwell Cocke at the University of Virginia; and the will and accompanying documents of Philip St. George Cocke, son of J.H. Cocke.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: John Hartwell Cocke (1780-1866) was a planter, agricultural reformer, and brigadier general in the War of 1812.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Collection contains Cocke's letters concerning the purchase of land in Perry Co., Ala., the weather, crop conditions, prices, and the health of slaves. Other items include letters to Dr. Cary Charles Cocke, son of J.H. Cocke; a report on the progress of a younger John Hartwell Cocke at the University of Virginia; and the will and accompanying documents of Philip St. George Cocke, son of J.H. Cocke.
